name: 1 - Ensure room layout, cabinets and equipment have been approved
2 - Confirm that cable support system has been completed as documented
3 - Adhere to a single certified system throughout a new building installation
4 - Comply with the detailed installation specifications
5 - Network cables have been appropriately sized and selected to ensure that they will support currently installed and future equipment
6 - Connections have been correctly terminated and insulated to ensure perfect connectivity and protect against faults and interference
7 - Sufficient spare cable has been left coiled up outside of the cabinet
8 - Check all internal wiring as per panel wiring diagram. Has all equipment including cable managers been installed as per rack layout
9 - Has a dedicated power circuit been supplied for the cabinet
10 - Is there a steel tray/raceway installed between each cabinet to accommodate linking patch leads
11 - All cabling has been tested using the Fluke data tester
12 - Undergo certification tests prior to acceptance of work completed
13 - Provide copies of certification tests to the Office of IT Services
